A1.body: You're back alive and well, that's good. How did it go?
A1.speaker: Coronel

A3.body: A strong statement. How can you prove it?
A3.speaker: Coronel

A4.body: Hmm ... it doesn't say he's one of our own. But here we are talking about an attempt on the Minister's life. This is very serious.
A4.speaker: Coronel

A5.body: I'll investigate if it makes you feel better, okay? But not now, we have a much more important problem.
A5.speaker: Coronel

A6.body: The theater in the city will soon host a closed presentation. A scientist is going to show Minister Twilight his latest develops.
A6.speaker: Coronel

A7.body: I want you to be there in case something happens.
A7.speaker: Coronel

A8.body: None of the other Ministers are planning to visit our city in the next few months, so I would not expect that he is going to organize an attempt on them.
A8.speaker: Coronel

A9.body: But Minister Twilight is coming in a few days, and she will have a minimum amount of security at this time. This is where you come in handy.
A9.speaker: Coronel

A10.body: Equestria is counting on you, Lieutenant. You can go now.
A10.speaker: Coronel

A1(1).body: I report: The enemy agent was successfully eliminated, but he did not bring any money. He originally knew who I was.
A1(1).speaker: Strikely

A2(1).body: I think there's a traitor in our ranks.
A2(1).speaker: Strikely

A3(1).body: He had a note with him [give the note]
A3(1).speaker: Strikely

A4(1).body: There is indeed a traitor among us, otherwise he would never have known that I was a fake agent!
A4(1).speaker: Strikely
